manuscript_citation: Aw WC, Towarnicki SG, Melvin RG, Youngson NA, Garvin MR, Hu Y, Nielsen S, Thomas T, Pickford R, Bustamante S, Vila-Sanjurjo A, Smyth GK, Ballard JWO (2018) Genotype to phenotype: Diet-by-mitochondrial DNA haplotype interactions drive metabolic flexibility and organismal fitness. PLoS Genet 14(11): e1007735. doi: 10.1371/journal.pgen.1007735

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"ftj90","text":"For RNA extraction, 6 female third instar wandering larvae were homogenised in TRI reagent (Sigma) in a Precellys 24 homogeniser (Bertin Technologies, \u00eele-de-France, France).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"80g9n","text":"RNA was extracted with the standard TRI reagent protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bft7v","text":"1.5 \u00b5g of total RNA was treated with DNase I Amplification Grade (Sigma).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b3mu2","text":"cDNA was prepared from 1.5 \u00b5g RNA template in 20 \u00b5l reaction mixture using a ProtoScript cDNA synthesis kit (New England Biolabs, MA, USA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"71d18","text":"The comparative cycle threshold (Ct) method was used to analyse the qPCR studies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2nf11","text":"The expression of mtDNA genes was quantified by the following primers: ATP6 forward 5\u2019-AGAATAGCGGGTGTTCCTTGA-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-CCATCAGGTCATAATGGATCT-5\u2019; ND4 forward 5\u2019-AACTGGAGCTTCAACATGAGC-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-AGCCAGAACGTTTACAAGCTG-5\u2019; ND6 forward 5\u2019-AATTCATCCATTAGCTTTAGG-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-AGAGGCTAAAGATGTTACGTA-5\u2019; 12srRNA forward 5\u2019-TGGCGGTATTTTAGTCTATCT-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-AAGCTACACCTTGATCTGATA-5\u2019; and lrRNA forward 5\u2019-AGTCTAACCTGCCCACTGAAA-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-AGGGTCTTCTCGTCTTTTAAA-5\u2019.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5cj0f","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"240eq","text":"The expression of nuclear genes was quantified by the following primers: GSTE1 5\u2019- TCTTCTTCGATGCCAGTGTAATC-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-CACTGGCATCGAAGAAGAGAC-5\u2019","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":73,"length":5,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"60lcp","text":"GstE5 5\u2019- GGTAACTACATTTGGGACTCGC-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019- ATCTCTGGGATACAGGGCATC-5\u2019; Notch forward 5\u2019-GTCGGCGACTACTGTGAACAC-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-GTTGCGAAAGGTCACCTGACA-5\u2019;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":6,"style":"italic"},{"offset":75,"length":6,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5o9dt","text":"CrebB forward 5\u2019-ATGGACAACAGCATCGTCGA-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-ACGACATCGACCACGTCATT-5\u2019; eloF forward 5\u2019-GCACATTGATTGGCTATCTGCT-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019- GATTTGGTAGGCTTTCAGGACA-5\u2019; bmm forward 5\u2019-AAGTATGCACCGCATCTGTTG-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-CAAATCGCAGAGGAGACAGC-5\u2019;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":5,"style":"italic"},{"offset":78,"length":4,"style":"italic"},{"offset":160,"length":4,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3va1l","text":"Ilp2 forward 5\u2019-ATGAGCAAGCCTTTGTCCTTC-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-ACCTCGTTGAGCTTTTCACTG-5\u2019; ERR forward 5\u2019-GACCTCTCTATCCTGCGATTTG-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-CCACTTGTACCACTTCCTTTCAG-5\u2019; Zw forward 5\u2019- TTTGACGGCAAGATTCCGCA-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":4,"style":"italic"},{"offset":79,"length":3,"style":"italic"},{"offset":160,"length":3,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ies4","text":"CACCAGAGCGTGGGGTAGA-5\u2019; Inr forward 5\u2019-AAGCGTGGGAAAATTAAGATGGA-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019- GGCTGTCAACTGCTTCTACTG-5\u2019","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":24,"length":3,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nvk8","text":"The qRT-PCR program included denaturing at 95\u00b0 C for 5 min and amplification in 40 cycles of 95\u00b0 C for 10 s followed by 60\u00b0 C for 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1e9v","text":"Amplification was followed by a melting curve from 72\u00b0 C to 95\u00b0 C, rising by steps of 0.5\u00b0 C, to verify that a single product was amplified.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42j7v","text":"The mean Ct values of the mitochondrial-encoded genes and nuclear-encoded genes ranged from 7.9-11.5 and 20.8-27.8, respectively","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4nrok","text":"The mean Ct values of the housekeeping genes ranged from 8.3-16.5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8g91v","text":"The mRNA levels were expressed as the relative fold change against the normalised\u00a0rp49\u00a0and Actin88 mRNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":82,"length":4,"style":"italic"},{"offset":91,"length":8,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73k87","text":"t-tests were used to determine significance. Benjamini-Hochberg\u2019s correction was used to control the FDR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
